title: Griot
summary: A griot (/ˈɡriːoʊ/; French: [ɡʁi.o];  Manding: jali or jeli (in N'Ko: ߖߋߟߌ‎,[1] djeli or djéli in French spelling); Serer: kevel or kewel / okawul;[2][3] Wolof: gewel) is a West African historian, storyteller, praise singer, poet, or musician. The griot is a repository of oral tradition and is often seen as a leader due to their position as an advisor to royal personages. As a result of the former of these two functions, they are sometimes called a bard.
